Got this in a px these are not my thing to be hones think it’s a 66 rolling shel
Dore’s shell is mint no rot at all .under the van is like new
Some parts with the van new orner will have to register it . You no the cost to do a shell to this condition 07879332447

dear seller,

Iam interested to buy this bus

how complete is the bus?

thanks

kind regards

Bart Veldman
like to know what bits you have for it ,are vin tags ,m code plate there ,any docs with it ?? engine ,transmission etc and location please
Also interested what paper work do you have for it please

Hi
I’m very interested with cash waiting, I too would like to know the same info as Gerald2613...
What bits do you have to go with it windows, lights, locks, handles, engine, gearbox, docs.
Any vin tags, m plate attached, title docs?
Where are you located please.
Many thanks

Hi
I’m very interested with cash waiting, I too would like to know the same info as Gerald2613...
What bits do you have to go with it windows, lights, locks, handles, engine, gearbox, docs.
Any vin tags, m plate attached, title docs?
Where are you located please.
Many thanks

CAVEAT EMPTOR

Photograph of Division with screw holes shows that there was an m code plate.

Looks a nice project but why is it this price/ cheap?
If it was taken in part exchange why does the seller not build it up?
Just saying to help Newbies.
Those that have bought and completed a project know where the money goes buying missing items!
Without VIN tags, Body stamping, m code plate, Correct Nova paperwork it is only worth body cuts value.
Take care if this has been written off! It is unregisterable if it has.

CAVEAT EMPTOR

BEST TO CONSIDER VERY CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU BUY

Like above, van is a 66-67 model year, large radio hole so should be 12v, one year parts, I see a wiper unit there and a box of bits, £9000 is a good price depending on what's there, I'm not saying it's not worth it, but talking from many years experience building buses, it's never as easy as you think.
For me, I'd always buy a complete van wreck or mint, parts are a pain to find in good working order and if you are a newbie and have no mates with any idea about these then leave well alone.
There is and will be guys who not only have the skill and knowledge out there to turn this around, build a great van and still make a profit as the hard, dirty work looks to have been done, let's face it, to buy a good running she'll, paint it has to be close to what's being asked if it's a good job.
Hopefully there is still paint left over as to match will me a minefield, yes, I tried on a van the same colour.........had the whole van resprayed in the end.
To put a lighter note on this, if I was 25 years younger, I'd be tempted but viewed first.
Good luck with the sale, I'm sure it will sale.

Rocket
